data.body:
Hi, can somebody please help me?
I'm try to make code with VS code but i have a big problem with the syntax error (does is no showed) in the files attached you can look:
**1. VS Code with a large project opened (don't show any error)**

Thanks and regards

data.title: C++ intelliSense: discover include paths in the project directory
data.body:
It's kind of annoying to have to include project subdirectory paths into the `c_cpp_properties.json` file as include directories, when they've already been indexed and can be opened with `ctrl+p`. Can't subdirectories of the current open directory automatically be included as include paths if they contain at least one `.h`/`.hpp` file?

It would also be nice if you could optionally include subdirectories of an existing include path. It would come in handy for frameworks like Boost or Qt.

data.title: For C++, autoconvert '.' to '->' when the type is a pointer
data.body:
First off, the new intelliSense engine is awesome! Exactly what we've been waiting for. Thanks for taking our feedback and making that happen.

It seems to me that when the "Default" engine is enabled and doesn't need to fallback to the tag parser, you have enough type information to separate pointer objects from non pointer objects. It would be really nice in those cases to convert '.' to '->' if the object type is a pointer (or vice versa).

data.title: Support additive files.exclude settings on a per-workspace basis
data.body:
Often I want to exclude some files from a project, which means doing it in the Workspace Settings. Unfortunately this means overriding the whole `files.exclude` setting, which in turn means it can become stale if further exclusions are added to `files.exclude` in User Settings.

I'd love to be able to **add to** `files.exclude` on a per-workspace basis. Maybe a setting such as `files.exclude.append`, which gets appended to the global `files.exclude` setting?

- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:13:05.928Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.13.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Open a `.jsx` file.
2. Type `<div>`/`div` or any other combination and press enter/tab.
3. On first run, typing `div` and hitting tab _will_ auto complete only once.
4. Afterwards, tag auto complete does not work at all.

**Reproduces without extensions:** Yes

I have no extensions installed.

data.title: test explorer
data.body:
Hi,
I am the author of mocha-typescript and I would like to add a VSCode extension that would:
 - Run all tests on file change and print the results on the integrated terminal
 - Display an overlay over the code with test status and buttons to re-run the particular tests (similar to the merge conflict resolution buttons)
 - Display a tree view in the left hand panel with all tests and their statuses along options to enable/disable the watcher in point 1, as well butttons to rerun tests or just the failed tests
Are these possible using an official extensibility API?
Do you have plans to provide something similar (VisualStudio has test explorer)?
If these are possible could you give me some directions to the APIs I should use?

data.title: Represent lables without normalisation in workbench

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

This has been originally reported [here](/hbenl/vscode-firefox-debug/issues/41)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. start a debugging session using the Chrome or Firefox debug adapter (those are the ones I checked)
2. step into a remote source that can't be mapped to a local path by the debug adapter
3. have a look at the tooltip shown for the remote source - it will display e.g. `http:\test.com\file.html` instead of the correct `http://test.com/file.html`

When the debug adapter wants to send a `Source` object for a remote file to VS Code, it can do so by setting the `path` to the URL of the remote file and adding a `sourceReference` which can be used by VS Code to retrieve the file content from the debug adapter.
This is working fine, except that on Windows the URL is slightly garbled when it's presented to the user in the tooltip - VS Code seems to insist on interpreting the `path` property as a local file path (which is why `/` is replaced with `\` on Windows), but in this case it's not.
I think VS Code should not modify the `path` property if the `sourceReference` property is set, because this signals that the `Source` object does not correspond to a local file but something else (a remote file or a script passed to `eval()`, for example).

data.title: Feature request: save open terminals with project
data.body:
It would be helpful if open inline terminals could be saved with project.
Example: I often have one terminal for the Bin directory, one for the Build directory, and several at various places in the source tree. Presently I have to always re-open the terminals after restarting Code.

Thanks!

data.title: Wrong text type recognition behind specific regexp in powershell function
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|code-runner|formulahendry|0.6.24|
|format-php|Kasik96|1.1.2|
|perl-debug|mortenhenriksen|0.2.3|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|1.4.1|
|easy-snippet-maker|tariky|0.0.5|
|plsql-language|xyz|1.0.4|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.
type this to VS Code editor as powershell function and see wrong coloring
```powershell
function aaa {
    param(
        [Parameter()]
        [ValidateScript( {$_ -match '^[_a-z0-9-]+(\.[_a-z0-9-]+)*@[a-z0-9-]+(\.[a-z0-9-]+)*(\.[a-z]{2,4})$'})]
        [string] $ReplyTo = "admins@fi.muni.cz", # everything after end of previous line is brown, but it shouldnt be
        [string] $hascolorasitistext    
    )
}
```

2. everything after match is brown, as it is common text
3. but if i use this shorter regexp everything is back to normal
```powershell
function aaa {
    param(
        [Parameter()]
        [ValidateScript( {$_ -match '^[_a-z0-9-]+(\.[_a-z0-9-]+)*@[a-z0-9-'})]
        [string] $ReplyTo = "admins@fi.muni.cz",
        [string] $hascolorasitistext    
    )
}
```

data.title: UI renders too small when a popup is triggered from a 100% scaled monitor but rendered onto a 150% scaled monitor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code on the right monitor that is scaled to 100% with HD resolution.
2. Cause some popup to appear on a monitor to the left that is scaled to 150% with UHD resolution (i.e. the ... button in the Git explorer).

Bug: The popup that appears in the 150% scaled screen is not scaled to 150% (it's too small at 100% scaling).

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Insiders 1.14.0 cannot render extension icons that are SVGs
data.body:
I checked the top four missing icons (_Python_, _ESLint_, _Beautify_, and _One Dark Pro_), and all of those extensions use SVG icons, while every PNG icon seems to work fine.

This is not a problem on regular Code (1.13.1, not Insiders).

I see #29415, so are SVG icons no longer allowed? Should I report this issue to every extension that uses an SVG as its icon so that they can switch to PNGs?

## Screenshot of the problem in Insiders 1.14.0
![screen shot 2017-06-30 at 4 31 26 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4754114/27757140-e84b2ab2-5db2-11e7-8751-c3eff44064f3.png)

data.title: Css/Scss autocomplete gives wrong result the first time when you press Tab
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

I use emmet everywhere, on codepen, sublime, etc. 
But at first try I get stuff that is not what you would expect

1. bc -> background-color   Instead:  backface-visibility
2. posrel -> position-relative Instead: ::-webkit-progress-inner-element
3. bb -> border-bottom  Instead: break-before 
4. ttu -> text-transform: uppercase;  Instead: text-underline-position ???? what is this even

So as you can see this completely halts me in my way of using VSCODE for frontend dev.

I need emmet to work. It works if i do ctrl+z and then press tab again. Retarded suggestion doesn't show up second time. 

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Search viewlet multiroot UI
data.body:
We need to determine what the UI for multiroot searches in the search viewlet will look like, and experiment with different possibilities. This will be influenced in part by multiroot UI decisions elsewhere in the product.

Separate issue for functionality and include/exclude behavior in multi and single root workspaces: #27226

A few initial options:
- Group results under a new node per root folder where the list still scrolls together (mostly implemented here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/29964#issuecomment-312380260)
- Group results in subviews that scroll independently (git viewlet?)
- Leave them in a flat list, but make the folder name stand out somehow

data.title: ember-cli on Windows, VSCode (Visual Studio Code), "EPERM: operation not permitted, mkdir" many times when I save.
data.body:
I'm on **Windows 10 x64**, **VSCode** (Visual Studio Code, both Stable and Insiders).

"**EPERM: operation not permitted, mkdir**" many times when I save. I just save again and the problem disappears. But is very annoying...

Using "handle.exe" this is my situation in my EmberApp folder:

```
$ handle -a tmp

Nthandle v4.1 - Handle viewer
Copyright (C) 1997-2016 Mark Russinovich
Sysinternals - www.sysinternals.com

svchost.exe        pid: 6032   type: File           2A8: C:\Users\Nickname\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windows\Notifications\WPNPRMRY.tmp
Code.exe           pid: 6872   type: File            D4: C:\projects\emberApp\tmp\funnel-output_path-2vNvynVB.tmp\routes

Code.exe           pid: 6872   type: File           440: C:\projects\emberApp\tmp\funnel-output_path-2vNvynVB.tmp\routes\authors
Code.exe           pid: 6872   type: File           450: C:\projects\emberApp\tmp\funnel-output_path-2vNvynVB.tmp
Code.exe           pid: 6872   type: File           450: C:\projects\emberApp\tmp\funnel-output_path-2vNvynVB.tmp
Code.exe           pid: 6872   type: File           470: C:\projects\emberApp\tmp\funnel-output_path-2vNvynVB.tmp\routes\authors\book\sum
Code.exe           pid: 6872   type: File           470: C:\projects\emberApp\tmp\funnel-output_path-2vNvynVB.tmp\routes\authors\book\sum
Code.exe           pid: 6872   type: File           478: C:\projects\emberApp\tmp\filter-tmp_dest_dir-n4SyE39H.tmp
Code.exe           pid: 6872   type: File           478: C:\projects\emberApp\tmp\filter-tmp_dest_dir-n4SyE39H.tmp
Code.exe           pid: 6872   type: File           478: C:\projects\emberApp\tmp\filter-tmp_dest_dir-n4SyE39H.tmp
Code.exe           pid: 6872   type: File           47C: C:\projects\emberApp\tmp
```

My VSCode settings are:

```
{
  "files.exclude": {
    "node_modules": true,
    "typings": true,
    "tmp": true,
    "dist": true,
    "coverage": true
  },
  "files.watcherExclude": {
    "**/tmp/**": true,
    "**/tmp": true,
    "**/node_modules/**": true
  },
  "search.exclude": {
    "tmp": true,
    "vendor": true
  }
}
```

I tried also everything possible: `**/tmp` or `tmp` alone. Everything and I reloaded every time VSCode. Nothing, after the first save the problem.

My **jsconfig.json**:

```
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "es6",
    "experimentalDecorators": true
  },
  "exclude": ["node_modules", "bower_components", "tmp", "vendor", ".git", "dist"]
}
```

Also I don't have any extension in VSCode.

---

Output from `ember version --verbose && npm --version && yarn --version`:
```
ember-cli: 2.13.2
http_parser: 2.7.0
```

- OS Version: Windows 10.1 x64

data.body: It seems the scientific community has gravitated to this IDE https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder for reasons not completely apparent to me. From what I can see - there is a rather splendid variable explorer where you can input / edit / export variables executed.

data.title: Incorrect unindentation in Ruby case statements
data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:18:03.540Z) - OS Version: Linux x64 4.8.0-58-generic - Extensions: disabled via `code --disable-extensions` --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. In a Ruby file, type a `when` line and press Enter: Expected Results: The `when` line maintains the same level of indentation, as in [The Ruby Style Guide]: ```ruby def example(response) case response when Net::HTTPSuccess ``` Actual Results: The `when` line is unindented: ```ruby def example(response) case response when Net::HTTPSuccess ``` The behavior in 1.14.0-insider is similar, unindenting immediately after `when` is typed. [The Ruby Style Guide]: https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#source-code-layout
